title: Inter-ethnic clashes in eastern Congo kill 22 people
text: February 26, 2018 / 8:11 PM / Updated 10 minutes ago Inter-ethnic clashes in eastern Congo kill 22 people Reuters Staff 1 Min Read GOMA, Democratic Republic of Congo (Reuters) - Inter-ethnic clashes in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo have killed at least 22 people, including 15 civilians, over the past two days, a local official said on Monday. Militiamen from the Hutu-dominated Nyatura militia attacked a Nande-dominated militia called Mai Mai Mazembe in the village of Kalusi on Sunday and Bwalanda on Monday, local administrator Hope Sabini told Reuters. Eleven civilians were killed in the fighting in Kalusi, while four civilians and seven militiamen were killed in Bwalanda, Sabini said. Reporting by Aaron Ross; Editing by Alison Williams
